core

Class KeyUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.KeyUtils

  • public final class KeyUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an utility class which contains methods to display a key in PEM format, in the form of a base-64 string ; and methods to convert a base-64 String in PEM format to a PublicKey, PrivateKey or Certificate object.
    Author:
    Alexandre Colicchio, Andy Chabalier, Philippe Letaif, Thibaud Gasser

      • publicKeyFromString

        public static java.security.PublicKey publicKeyFromString(java.lang.String b64Key)
                                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                          java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Get the public key link to the b64Key input argument with the specification contained
        Parameters:
        b64Key - Public key encoded in base64 in PEM format.
        Returns:
        The Public Key
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no Provider supports a KeyFactorySpi implementation for the specified algorithm.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the given key specification is inappropriate for this key factory to produce a public key.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if b64Key is not in valid Base64 scheme.

      • certificateFromString

        public static java.security.cert.Certificate certificateFromString(java.lang.String b64Cert)
                                                            throws java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Get the certificate link to the b64Cert input argument
        Parameters:
        b64Cert - Certificate encoded in base64 in PEM format
        Returns:
        The certificate
        Throws:
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if error while decoding Base64 input

                                                     throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                            java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                            java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Get the private key link to the b64Key input argument with the specification contained
        Parameters:
        b64Key - Private key encoded in base64 in PEM format.
        Returns:
        The private key
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no Provider supports a KeyFactorySpi implementation for the specified algorithm.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the given key specification is inappropriate for this key factory to produce a public key.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if error while decoding Base64 input

      • decodeKey

        private static byte[] decodeKey(java.lang.String b64Key)
                         throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Decodes a Base64 encoded String into a newly-allocated byte array.
        Parameters:
        b64Key - Key encoded in base64 in PEM format.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the decoded bytes.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if error while decoding Base64 input
